Otto

“A carrot a day keeps the framework away”

WSGI-compliant HTTP publisher for Python

Otto uses a routes-like syntax to map URLs to code and supports object traversal.

You can use the publisher to write web applications. It was designed with both small and large applications in mind. The documentation includes a complete reference and numerous examples.

Otto works with Python 2.6 or newer.

This software is made available under the BSD license.

See the PyPi project page for package information or check out the source code from the Repository. For questions or support, join the #otto channel on freenode irc.
